docs.lead_paragraph: A determination by the Senate parliamentarian complicates voting issues surrounding the latest challenge to the president’s signature legislation.

headline.main: Senate Rules Entangle Bid to Repeal Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Senate Rules Complicate Bid to Repeal Health Care Law

docs.abstract: Senate leaders reveal that chamber parliamentarian Elizabeth MacDonough has ruled that some of provisions contained within House-passed budget reconciliation bill repealing aspects of Affordable Care Act do not qualify for expedited proceedings; ruling means Republicans in Senate would have to obtain supermajority of 60 votes to repeal individual and employer mandates.
docs.snippet: A determination by the Senate parliamentarian complicates voting issues surrounding the latest challenge to the president’s signature legislation.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Surgeons at the Cleveland Clinic are set to become the first in the United States to transplant a uterus.

headline.main: Uterus Transplants May Soon Help Some Infertile Women in the U.S. Become Pregnant
headline.print_headline: Doctors to Try Transplanting a Donor Uterus

docs.abstract: Doctors at Cleveland Clinic will become first in United States to transplant uterus into woman who does not have one, enabling her to become pregnant and give birth; transplants will be temporary, with uterus being removed after recipient has had one or two babies; experimental procedure, which has only been completed successfully in Sweden, poses many risks.
docs.snippet: Surgeons at the Cleveland Clinic are set to become the first in the United States to transplant a uterus.

docs.lead_paragraph: About a third of Americans insured by Medicaid in 2014 were cigarette smokers. The figure for the privately insured? 13 percent.

headline.main: U.S. Smoking Rate Declines, but Poor Remain at Higher Risk

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports smoking continues to decline in United States with 16.8 percent of adults, down from 17.8 percent, smoking in 2013; report shows that less educated Americans smoke in far higher numbers than do those with graduate degree, and that poor smoke in higher numbers.
docs.snippet: About a third of Americans insured by Medicaid in 2014 were cigarette smokers. The figure for the privately insured? 13 percent.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The conservative Republican governor of Alabama, a Deep South state where "Obamacare" is often reviled, said Thursday that his administration is mulling an expansion of the state's Medicaid program under the federal health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two U.S. consumer groups announced the formation of a coalition with New York labor unions on Thursday to press antitrust regulators to oppose big insurance mergers that would cut the number of nationwide for-profit health insurers from five to three.
